org.talend.commons.ui.swt.tablereflect
Class TableReflect

java.lang.Object
  org.talend.commons.ui.swt.tablereflect.TableReflect

public class TableReflect
extends java.lang.Object

A concrete Table viewer based on the JFace TableViewer and the SWT Table control.

This class is intended to make easier creation and use of a table. For a basic usage you need create columns with TableReflectColumn and init a addedObjects of objects. The addedObjects will be introspected to retrieve values of each its objects. Each object of the addedObjects will represent one line in the Table. The following functions are already implemented : sort, automatic resize of columns (see layoutMode), and basic functions. You can access directly to instanciated TableViewer and Table to manage, add custom listeners or other usages. Filtering is not currently implemented, but you can add manually yours.

You can add CellEditor using TableReflectColumn and setCellEditor() method. According case you will have to override certain methods of CellEditorValueAdapter.

You can add TableEditor using TableReflectColumn and setTableEditor() method. According case you will have to override certain methods of TableEditorInitializer.

Read the following steps to create a reflect table :

1) instanciate TableReflect

2) configure, the methods below are used to configure internally style of Table object, so if you want use these methods call them before createTable :
- setLineSelection
- setShowSelection
- setCheckboxInFirstColumn
- setBorderVisible
- setHorizontalScroll
- setVerticalScroll
- setHeaderVisible
- setLinesVisible

3) optionally call createTable if you need initialize Table's children components before init call.

4) create TableReflectColumn columns and configure them.
Description of the main parameters :
- beanPropertyName represents the property of each object of your addedObjects which will be read (and write).
- idProperty (optional) represents the unique id of the column, it is by default the value of beanPropertyName. If the unicity is not respected, a assertion is thrown.
- set a width or a weight value.
- see others parameters in TableReflectColumn

5) set commons value for columns as you want, call them before init :
- setAllColumnsMoveable
- setAllColumnsResizable
- setAllColumnsSortable

6) call init method with your addedObjects of objects in parameter.

See Also:
org.eclipse.jface.viewers#TableViewer,

$Id$

Method Detail

init

public void init()

Create a new instance of Table with its TableColumn and create also a new instance of TableViewer if these objects doesn't exist already.

Initialize the TableViewer with by default the DefaultStructuredContentProvider, the DefaultTableLabelProvider and the DefaultTableViewerSorter.

init

public void init(java.lang.Object input)

Create a new instance of Table with its TableColumn and create also a new instance of TableViewer if these objects doesn't exist already.

Initialize the TableViewer with by default the DefaultStructuredContentProvider, the DefaultTableLabelProvider and the DefaultTableViewerSorter.

If you use the default ContentProvider, you must set as input an object which extends Collection.

If it is the second or more time than you call this method, only the input object is loaded. Call methods of TableViewer for others operations.

Parameters:
input - by default a object which extends Collection.
